At 10:58 AM 14/12/01, you wrote:
>On Fri, 14 Dec 2001, Cormac Mullally <Cormac.Mullally@...>
>wrote:
>
> > I can use
> > SourceResourceLoader.getResourceAsStream(this.getClass(),"Name of
> > file"); to get an InputStream to a file but I dot know how to get a
> > File class from this.
>
>If all you want to do is passing it to a SAX parser, getting the
>InputStream is all you need to do.


That depends on how you have the dtd call set up. You may find that the 
parser searches for the dtd relative to the current (working) directory, 
rather than relative to the xml file.
We're having problems with this: we're using xml to define a series of 
constants that are accessed both from a web application in tomcat and from 
various applications that run independently. The current solution (which no 
doubt could be improved) is to load the location of the xml file from a 
ResourceBundle, and have the xml file hardcode the location of the dtd 
using a full (non-relative) path.




Another solution to the original problem is to load the locations from an 
ini file located in ${user.home}. This avoids hardcoding the location of 
the ini.
